stories.original_headline: Life may have started as sticky goo clinging to rocks
stories.original_summary: Life may have started in sticky, rock-hugging gels rather than inside cells. Researchers suggest these primitive, biofilm-like materials could trap and concentrate molecules, giving early chemistry a protected space to grow more complex. Within these gels, the first hints of metabolism and self-repl
stories.fantasy_headline: Ancient Alchemists Uncover Life's Sticky Beginnings on Rocks
stories.fantasy_story: Wise Alchemists now ponder if all life began as magical sludge clinging to ancient stones. They believe these gels gathered potent essences, offering a safe haven for primitive enchantments to grow complex. Within this mystical goo, the very first sparks of life and self-replication may have ignited.

stories.original_headline: Interstellar comet 3I/ATLAS is spraying water across the solar system
stories.original_summary: For millions of years, a frozen wanderer drifted between the stars before slipping into our solar system as 3I/ATLAS—only the third known interstellar comet ever spotted. When scientists turned NASA’s Swift Observatory toward it, they caught the first-ever hint of water from such an object, detected
stories.fantasy_headline: Wandering Ice-Star Sprays Life-Giving Dew Across Our Realm
stories.fantasy_story: A frozen wanderer, known as the ice-star Atlas, has journeyed from between the stars into our realm. Court wizards, gazing through their greatest viewing orb, detected a mist of life-giving dew spraying from its tail. This celestial traveler brings a rare spectacle, hinting at wonders beyond our known skies.

stories.original_headline: Samsung’s offering up to $900 of trade-in credit toward its new phones
stories.original_summary: Samsung’s next Unpacked event is happening on February 25th, and we anticipate the company will announce the Galaxy S26 lineup of phones. There may be some new wearables and earbuds announced, too. In addition to the showing off the new hardware, Galaxy AI software is likely to be a big part of the
stories.fantasy_headline: Star-Crafts Guild Offers Gold for Old Scrying Mirrors!
stories.fantasy_story: The esteemed Star-Crafts Guild prepares to unveil its newest enchanted scrying mirrors, adorned with powerful intellects. For a limited time, the Guild offers many gold coins in exchange for your older, less magical communication devices. Seek out their merchants soon to witness these wonders and claim your generous discount.

stories.original_headline: Microsoft fixes Notepad flaw that could trick users into clicking malicious Markdown links
stories.original_summary: Microsoft has fixed a serious security vulnerability affecting Markdown files in Notepad. In the company's Tuesday patch notes, Microsoft says a bad actor could carry out a remote code execution attack by tricking users "into clicking a malicious link inside a Markdown file opened in Notepad," as re
stories.fantasy_headline: Scribes' Guild Patches Flaw in Enchanted Scrolls!
stories.fantasy_story: The diligent Royal Scribes' Guild has mended a worrying flaw within their Enchanted Message Scrolls. A cunning trickster might once have deceived unwary readers into touching cursed runes embedded within the scrolls. This magical loophole, which allowed for distant dark enchantments, has now been secured by the Guild's diligent wizards.
